api/LevelGenerator.Generator.LevelGenera.title: Class LevelGenerator | Grid Level Generator Documentation
api/LevelGenerator.Generator.LevelGenera.keywords: Class LevelGenerator The static Level Generator. Inheritance System.Object LevelGenerator Namespace : LevelGenerator.Generator Assembly : cs.temp.dll.dll Syntax public static class LevelGenerator Methods ClearCache() Declaration public static void ClearCache() ClearLevel() Destroys the current level completely with all of the instantiated GridRoom s. Declaration public static void ClearLevel() Remarks The levelSeed will not be deleted, but will be replaced once a new level is generated. DisableCaching() Disables scene caching for saving info on generated levels. Declaration public static void DisableCaching() See Also EnableCaching() EnableCaching() Enables scene caching for saving info on generated levels. Declaration public static void EnableCaching() See Also DisableCaching() GenerateLevelFromSeed() Generates a Level from the current seed. If the seed is invalid it will generate a new level. Declaration public static void GenerateLevelFromSeed() See Also GenerateNewLevel() GenerateNewLevel() Generates a new level and from a new seed. Declaration public static void GenerateNewLevel() Examples This sample shows how to call the GenerateNewLevel() method from an ExampleClass component on a GameObject that also has a LevelGenerator component. using LevelGenerator.Generator; class ExampleClass : MonoBehaviour { private void Start() { LevelGenerator.GenerateNewLevel(); } } GetSeed() Returns the seed of the last generated level. Declaration public static string GetSeed() Returns Type Description System.String Level Seed string See Also SetSeed(String) GenerateLevelFromSeed() SetConfiguration(GeneratorConfig) Declaration public static void SetConfiguration(GeneratorConfig config) Parameters Type Name Description GeneratorConfig config SetSeed(String) Sets the seed for the LevelGenerator . Declaration public static bool SetSeed(string seed) Parameters Type Name Description System.String seed Level Seed string Returns Type Description System.Boolean true on success, false if seed is invalid Remarks The seed format is defined by four sections of 6-10 numbers, divided by a dash (-). Example seed: 2885257376-2099986581-1044521005-723764510 See Also GetSeed()
